title: Improve reporting of  "Retrying with next eth1 endpoint"
body:
Version 22.6.0

I had an ISP outage for a while today. Since my Eth1 node is remote, Teku experienced timeouts in contacting it. This resulted in looong stack traces (I am logging to CONSOLE).

The stack trace is not useful for timeout errors, so I suggest we suppress it and just print the warning.

This is similar to #5416. Note that the "Error publishing metrics to remote service: timeout" is handled nicely below. Likewise I probably don't need several pages of stack traces in one second as a result of my Eth1 node timing out.

Ditto the "ERROR - Failed to update eth1 chain head" could probably be quieter if we know that the Eth1 nodes are unreachable.

```
Jun 26 19:03:03 metalalbert teku[2344]: 2022-06-26 19:03:03.468 INFO  - Slot Event  *** Slot: 4120513, Block:                                                        ... empty, Justified: 128764, Finalized: 128763, Peers: 0
Jun 26 19:03:07 metalalbert teku[2344]: 2022-06-26 19:03:07.000 WARN  - Error publishing metrics to remote service: timeout
```
